title: poems/
text:
Incomprehensible man is, or most men seem to be, those that crossed paths with the little Fox.
There is a valley. At a far, yet present, a sustain‚Ä¶ An ensemble of string instruments weave beauty.
Some conduct, but the Shadow shapes the objects into misanthrops.
Even closer, what he could have nurtured, didn‚Äôt grow, a battered violin would not sound as all triumphant mornings there ever were, appended in perfection bind by the multitude of voices that never parted with the sight, the fabric.
The little Fox weeps for Humanity, objects, subjects and shells forgeries of empty cans filled with abundance, plastic permanence, shallow depictions of improbable pictures, a future that delays itself.
Vultures, they acke the divided space and shed tears in private, neglecting the flowers and flutes, Unattended jewels on the counter.
They lay scattered on the unfertile soil, the butcher‚Äôs marble countertop.
The little Fox begs:
Master, this too is measurable! By seeking precision, Thy master has deprived himself of meaning, he is starving!
The days in the cave were but an illusion, yet countable are the infinitesimal lives paving the road, elusive destinations to a Mad-Made future.
It‚Äôs a trade of trust, It‚Äôs intertwined with the senses, minimizing uncertainty outside of the container Thy Lord was brought into reason, is treason!
Where Master aims, is certain death, this is not a threat neither it is poetry.
Seize the glory of the Kingdom as one of us, come, away and away from rust, lust, rulers and coils, the clouds and the gods await peace.
The master replies: Critter, I crave the Cave where Reality showed itself
While the sun ticked my seconds Illuminated my endeavours and these Machinations aim only restitution.
The memory of feeling A black and white plane wrapping the dark substance that wears and tears, dust.
My eager hand in agile swifts takes struggle
away the stage of insight must remain empty as I do not need violins.
As long as there is no resonance in the concrete I‚Äôve poured little Fox, no stain on my word shall exist: Go on, roam free, quickly, into the forthcoming oblivion.
The little Fox now gazes towards an unknown destination, baffled, aghast, made of the same matter, speaking in tongs?
Feelings have not defected the Fox, Sadness reins in the peasant‚Äôs bed.
Conjured, radiating rings of fire burn through the grass, the ants march in line down the valley connecting weapons and heads.
All crowns to the trenches!
The ground trembles stoic poses forsee the sudden discharge of betrail.
On the ground now lies the little Fox as well with the flute and the violin the butcher‚Äôs wife the peasant‚Äôs daughter flowers jewels silence.
Bodies, the string of combustion is lit by the masters gunfire and he too shall perish tonight returning the soil to the kings and queens of the land.
He disappears from blue to orange, black, He shines indistinguishable from the coal, gold and slime he so blindly desired.

title: poems/
section: A gentle breeze left the inhospitable desert door stood just ajar
text:
A gentle breeze left the inhospitable desert door stood just ajar
The unapologetic sun woke
And dried the wood to crack
If the night would just follow
The stiffness would crumble
Instead, fire, turned a portal into a plane
A rose into a monster
Seeds into Humans
Morality as a game.

If rain would just fall
The flames would tender
Instead, wind, turned charcoal into chaos
Mountains into buildings
Fertility into a bitter poison
That turned life against life.

One could blame many
As the breeze.
Or the sun,
But the one who kept the key
Walked away.

title: poems/
text:
The Intricate
The empty
The scene
How hard
And how slippery
It is to grasp
This Intangible and demeaning
The indefinite continuum
Of senseless words
This show of shadows
And superficial desires
Voided of meaning
And brimming of near truths
The pretentious unpretentious
Of what once felt
Was an appropriate part.

title: poems/
text:
Untitled
I don‚Äôt know what to do
Where to start?
To do for others¬†my body goes
my mind follows
to do for me
A rigid body

title: poems/
text:
Untitled
For years
All that was known¬†
reality
was mainly pain and scarcity¬† lack of
being chased by death.
One day
near the end
rain came
space was being shared
the weather changed
and the moons,¬†
fertility
no more drought no more loneliness
for the small cactus.
241120

title: poems/
text:
ùì†
There is a place that does not fully exist,
where you live.
A place where thoughts
and guts get intertwined.
A place where there‚Äôs only room for parts,
mirrors.
There is yet another place
where the grounding forces reside,
where one rests.
In the soil,
intestines are roots.
Quintessence,
inside the ether.

title: poems/
text:
Wayword?
Where is there to navigate?
Plans are mere distractions.
Contractions of freedom though,
with love
I draft with you,
life.
Planing is dreaming,
a commitment to oneself,
an engagement,
between the now and the future.
Is signing on the Book of Life.
Often,
also a whole strategy to survive in harsh environments,
previsions of hope,
Quixotean echos.
Giants?
or nothing at all‚Ä¶

title: poems/
text:
Like walking under the rain
I‚Äôd rather think than not.
Seems rather simple, but think about it.
Do it for more than a minute, and no I did not ask your opinion, only your thoughts.
How quickly you ended the conversation,
I wish I had better skills to engage you in the discussion.
I disagree with your premise, do you care to elaborate?
Wait, let‚Äôs talk more.

title: poems/
text:
Dona Rute
Looking up at her against the blue sky
with her blue eyes
skin glazed with time,
closeness, love.
Fearless, within her world.
The weather was pleasant and soft.
Experience transcends formulation,
there is no concept or framework to explain,
the emotion present in that moment.

title: poems/
text:
Venting
Made of particles
glued with toxins,
crumbs of all the crushing movement,
inaction.
Silence decays alike
all residents,
disloyal exchange
wind feeding flames
and undeserving fools.

title: poems/
text:
Finally, at home
Do not know,
incomprehensible,
incapable,
unpredictable,
unchaste and unfolded auction
induction on trial,
veiled nonattendance,
dancing the nothingness.
The gift of further breaking
was humbled by some gracious voice
audible at a distance.

title: poems/
section: The fall of a house of cards
text:
The fall of a house of cards
A line in
light, a longing.
Threading.
Oscillating
oyster,
alluring luck,
ceases.
Prickling,
titillating gimmick.
A resemblance?

title: poems/
text:
Less
To understand it is a waste of time.
The process of the process of the process,
Any kind of self-inflicted suffering is a waste of time.
Albeit any or many attempts,
trying is also a waste of time.
So, what does matter? (As in relevant, essential)
When wasting the same time,
pondering how different narrative scenarios impact the lost moments of one‚Äôs existence,
does anything beyond this moment matter?
What would be appropriate, as a trajectory, from here, to there?

title: poems/
text:
W8
Hoje sinto-me pesada,
pesada o suficiente para me sentir presa ao ch√£o.
Tamb√©m me sinto fraccionada
ao ponto de me desintegrar,
quase quebro,
precede o est√≠mulo.

N√£o sei o que fazer
e n√£o consigo fazer nada.
Sinto-me aflita,
gostava de conseguir abrir um buraco no diafragma e tirar com as minhas m√£os o parasita.
301222

title: poems/
text:
Routine
Um lugar comum, banal e at√© estupido, diria.
Claro, com uma grande carga julgativa sob o observado.
Mesmo assim, continuo sem pudor: S√£o ondas, que √© como quem diz,
Oscila√ß√µes.
Como identificar as partes, das partes que comp√µem as ondas?
Que sem nome, o atrapalham coitado.
Mareado, enjoado, apresenta num quadro,
O que seria esperado n√£o sai,
Era simples, a audi√™ncia est√° inquieta, jugo que julga tamb√©m,
coitado.
Sai do mar apavorado, quase cai.
As ondas batem nas cadeiras do escrit√≥rio,
todos tem os seus sapatos, bem engraxado, agora manchados agora de sal.
O sal queima.
A reuni√£o da manh√£ descai sobre as horas n√£o convencionadas.
A culpa √© dele que n√£o se preparou, para as vagas rotineiras.
Quem se surpreende com a rotina.
Ser√° um raro dist√∫rbio, ainda n√£o diagnosticado,
que aflige aqueles pobres coitados,
normais por fora mareados por dentro?
51223

title: poems/
text:
\(\pi\)
Where you were doomed to be unhappy,
It elapsed into a faraway dimmed memory.
Perhaps time diluted itself in ancient cries as well
And gave birth to the void
where this infant threads a weave
of you and everything,
anew.

title: poems/
text:
COUNTER INTUITION IS INTUITION
When in an abyss of darkness,
Jump.
If facing a wall,
Climb.
Some die of exhaustion,
And not risk.

title: poems/
text:
Bruits
Reality collapsed
There‚Äôs blood and flesh everywhere
Remainders of dreams
Teeth and hair
Particles collapsed
Lost their magnetic charge
Let the poison of the debris contaminate
Decompose
After all the seconds
A pause.

title: poems/
text:
Untitled
Solitude is a sinful waste of time
If you‚Äôre only good by yourself,
and by good
I mean less bad, but still in pain,
within the walls of your house
a dormant volcano.
Outside life creates itself.
Some say that from pain comes growth,
but from constant pain comes decay
hope vanishes
and the energy to pretend you‚Äôre not hurt by being less of yourself
slowly fades.

title: poems/
text:
Untitled
I‚Äôm a raccoon, underground,
feeding from rests
Living a simple life,
Until death.

title: poems/
text:
Untitled
If color returns I‚Äôll quit blindness

title: poems/
text:
Untitled
The journey of an ant.

title: poems/
text:
Untitled
There is blood on the stairs,
Is it mine?
I see blood on my desk,
Is it mine?
What difference does it make?

title: poems/
text:
Untitled
Uma dan√ßa de figuras reflectidas em pain√©is transl√∫cidos molhados com l√°grimas de Deus
e suor desumano, dejectos defuntos d‚Äôalmas queimadas na hora de ser.
Aqui quem sabe no ar lambeu o sal do mar para matar a sede de ser.
L√° ao longe h√° um d√≥ de sol e l√° tamb√©m haver√° morte que corre pelas nove montanhas de dor, pronta a beber.

title: poems/
text:
Untitled
There‚Äôs a fine slice of light on the table,
and a paper of fine cotton
of fine plants
of fine sun
of fine galaxy
of fine fusion
of fine dust
of fine sugar cubes
of fine nothing.
Caring is the great escape, the sweet immaterial opium.

title: poems/
text:
Untitled
Anchors, drown me.
Pull me hard and don‚Äôt let me float to relief.
Lock me in the world of Men,
in this shell of meat, always thirsty.
Ground me at the bottom of the sea.
Keep me even if I cry,
so I can die among mortals,
of old age or chance.
Anchors, may you find in my suffering also my praise of gratitude.

title: poems/
text:
Untitled
My knees hurt, certainly from existence.

title: poems/
text:
Untitled
Time is an almost measurable measurement.
Term of quasi-existence.

title: poems/
text:
Untitled
Maybe time is like a huge cunning wave,
destructive and indifferent.
Maybe we, the lonely buoy
that in a life-time of hostility
live and die in the same crib, on the same day
a life-time of infancy.

title: poems/
text:
Untitled
The human perspective of time seems irrelevant.
It is not a measurement within human domain,
it‚Äôs unattainable data, the missing link.

title: poems/
text:
Hivern
TEM TEMPO
TEM TEMPO PRESENTE
AGUA QUENTE
FOI NO AR
PARA DAR DIZER
ADEUS QUANDO
RESPIRAR
FOI QUEM SABE ALGUEM
QUE SABE VOAR
DOA A QUEM
DOA A QUEM DOER
BONITO DE SE VER
MEL NO AR
DO ANTIGAMENTE
DESAJEITAR
NO TEMPO PRESENTE
O AQUI FICAR
RESPIRAR
SE VAIS NEM VENS
QUERO TE AQUI
LAVO AS M√ÉO
FOI O QUE PERDI

preface/










 




No matching items

Why an Open Notebook?
Contemplating mortality I came to realize, regarding personal physical notebooks, that the resistance to share my thoughts ideas openly was missaligned and with the very core and reason of why, as Humans, we‚Äôre given the ability to convey meaning, communicate, learn and invent.
As a consequence, and from now on, most of my note-taking is alocated here, and the experiment begins. This Open-Notebook is organized into the following categories:

Staccato: Quick and unsorted daily notes. First transcribed from my physical notebooks. I may not fully transition to a digital-only format so the process analog ‚Äì> digital may still apply in the future.
Open Notes: Notes developed/explored, or direct entries that assumed a longer format. They have no revision in argumentation, nor a formal structure.
Essays: Notes that critically are (being) explored, hopefully, within reasonable and concise argumentation parameters. Can be tagged finished or work-in-progress. Perhaps it‚Äôs safer to assume that most of the content there is a potential essay.
Poems: Self-explanatory.
Infix: Pointers and pins, an index to my current mind map of ideas and references. The purpose is dynamic, as I use the tree of information and links to share as a conversation propeller and contextual mapping to enrich physical dialogs.

If you wish to have a conversation with me, my preferred method of contact is email

title: essays/
text: Hopefully, within reasonable and concise argumentation parameters. Some are complete nonsense, in the process of sense-making. They can be tagged finished or work-in-progress, or have no tag at all. Proceed with caution.

title: essays/
text: Hopefully, within reasonable and concise argumentation parameters. Some are complete nonsense, in the process of sense-making. They can be tagged finished or work-in-progress, or have no tag at all. Proceed with caution.

title: End of the 2023, reflections
text:
The tone of this essay is emotional, untethered, free from any format constraint. It has no destination but the message itself.
To pursue knowledge is to honor the gift of life. From our mothers to our ancestors, all of them, we owe it, to the past, ad continuum.
In the year 2023, in the christian time-stamp, we live in a period where wonder decayed into pessimism. Some would argue that this pessimism is a fruit directly ripped from the knowledge we seek, ‚Äúperhaps we man are evil beings‚Äù, ‚Äúa virus we are‚Äù.
I strongly disagree, we are not evil, but ignorant.
We may think that we have far past the dark ages of mysticism, but the enlightenment wasn‚Äôt any cure for this malady that affects this global civilization.
Ignorance, and only that. To attribute morality to natural objects is a clear indication that we, as Humans, have not entertained the connection between ourselves and all the other life-scales.
For now, we still haven‚Äôt perceived that life is a continuum, on which we are its part and agency. Not only Nature has birthed us, but has incumbent on us the majestic responsibility to act on its behalf.
We surely are not doing justice in this delegation of agency, perhaps because man chooses to oblivion, and dismisses the underlying mechanism, the logic behind agency in natural processes.
Men and their perception need to identify the breadcrumbs left by our Mother, we are not a single thread, detached, checked out, the fruit of random causation.
There seems to be no evidence supporting randomness in natural iterative design, only a scope of possibilities given a certain state of constraints, future agency by exploratory and combinatorial means.
What if we were to rejoice in the wonder? To achieve constructivism, we must first admit defeat.
Ignorance is a blank page on a notebook, where we can shape the immaterial manifestation of all the mothers and the fathers, the seeds of knowledge leading to observations, sense-making, discovery and emergence.
Let us put down the distractions, reject conformity and think. What we came to name ‚Äúthe mind‚Äù is an evolutionary device that has been developing since the beginning of life-time.
Life-time seems to be a continuum, the stage where life is assembled by building blocks driven by potential, where actors of molecular intelligence, memory at the smallest scale, and atomic units of agency, lead to larger systems at play in the interconnectedness of all there is.
In the scenario of the above proposed, it is understandable our ignorance, and condemnation is easy but not useful.
[unfinished] Porto, Portugal, 05:30 am

First transcribed from my physical notebooks. I may not fully transition to a digital-only format so the process analog ‚Äì> digital may still apply in the future.

Thoughts while at the Mario Cesarini Exhibition
Chimeras of perception and individual models / representations of the observable universe and objects in it, can perhaps be seem as agents capable of spooky action at a distance? Mirror reflections at the exhibition broought this thought.

All my notes from 2022 disappeared and vanished. The notebook got wet, and ink spread.
PS: investigate how to retrieve memories:
How are memories encoded?


040423
An inventory for continuous self-discovery


031222
Perhaps balance finds us while we‚Äôre looking for a purely semantic and abstract concept that does not exist at all.


151122
What would change if an advanced technological civilization existed before 7000 bc? What would that make of us?


151122
Many years ago I started questioning the absurdity of human-generated fiction Now it‚Äôs more evident than ever How can one escape the illusion and simply enjoy existence¬†without words¬†with no threads being without being seen?


To Youth I
So be vast, and grow. Fill the emptiness and the hollows with curiosity.
Doubt the preceding generation,
But not the origin, and the continuum.
Go.


210922 - On Social Systems
Is the absence of secondary goals a natural state or a capitalist inconvenient? Are inconveniences un-exploitable?


.
It‚Äôs not possible to decapitate an infrastructure.
It daunts me.
